record.dc:title: 34MG31 Hiwassee Island Site 38MG31, Meigs County, Tennessee. 38MG31 - Village. Feature 26, House floor pattern with depressed floor, wall trenches, post molds, central hearth and a clear formation suggestive of a seat at left end of floor. Sq.1L14. Direction east.
record.wpa:narrative: Village site to the west of earthwork 37MG31. Rectangular structure from Lev. II, sunk into undisturbed. Floor of laminated layer of yellow clay. Postmolds set in wall trench along walls. At NW and SE ends a wedge shaped block projected out into floor at SE end 1.0' high. Firebasin had rectangular rim, part of fire pit was lower than rest. Some indication of interior posts across each end. Around walls evidence of burned posts and charred grass - probably thatch. Earth above floor was mottled clay and humus suggesting sod roof. Pottery all shell temper. Possibly all post holes not found.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution.
